> Dear Richard,\r
>\r
> I am writing to seek clarification of the 'openness' [1] of the DBLP =20=\r
\r
> data:\r
>\r
>  http://www4.wiwiss.fu-berlin.de/dblp/\r
\r
This service is based on data obtained from the Michael Ley's DBLP =20\r
project:\r
http://www.informatik.uni-trier.de/~ley/db/\r
\r
The copyright of the data remains with Michael Ley. We believe that we =20=\r
\r
are allowed to offer this service based on the following statement on =20=\r
\r
the DBLP website:\r
\r
"Copyright =A9 1993-2009 by Michael Ley ( Universit=E4t Trier, =\r
Informatik, ley@uni-trier.de=20\r
). Copying of the "DBLP" bibliography collection is permitted provided =20=\r
\r
that the copies are not made or distributed for direct commercial =20\r
advantage and credit for the source is given. To copy or republish =20\r
 otherwise requires specific permission."\r
\r
Best,\r
Richard\r
\r
\r
\r
>\r
> I wasn't able to find an explicit statement that the data was open =20\r
> such as a reference to an open knowledge or data license [2] so I'm =20=\r
\r
> writing to find out what the exact situation is. In particular we =20\r
> would like to know whether the material can be made available under =20=\r
\r
> an open license of some kind.\r
